intro: Evodiopanax gracilis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed evodiopanax, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and compound leaves with elongated, pointed leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
